intro: Ravensara oblonga, commonly known as the New Zealand native tree, is a member of the Lauraceae family. It is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are elliptical in shape and have a glossy, dark green upper surface. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by dark blue-black berries. Ravensara oblonga is native to the forests of New Zealand and is known for its aromatic properties. It is often used in traditional Māori medicine and as a source of essential oils.
